original: Source: MIDWEST ENERGY EMISSIONS CORP., 8-K, 6/4/2008 2.CONSIDERATION A.In consideration for the license of  rights granted hereunder in the Current Content, COMPANY hereby agrees to issue to YGP 16,200 shares of its Series A Convertible Preferred Stock for which YGP will pay COMPANY the sum of $1.00 per share or $16,200 in the  aggregate; NCM 3,000 of its Series A Convertible Preferred Stock for which NCM will pay COMPANY the sum of $1.00 per share or $3,000 in the aggregate and TWK 12,000 of its Series A Convertible  Preferred Stock for which TWK will pay COMPANY the sum of $1.00 per share or  $12,000 in the aggregate.  Prior to the execution hereof, CONTENT PROVIDER has been furnished with a copy of the  Certificate of Designation for the Series A Convertible Preferred Stock and is fully familiar with the terms and conditions thereof.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: MIDWEST ENERGY EMISSIONS CORP., 8-K, 6/4/2008
2.CONSIDERATION A.In consideration for the license of rights granted hereunder in the Current Content, YGP, NCM and TWK (collectively "Stockholders") hereby agree to issue a combined total of 21,400 shares of their Series A Convertible Preferred Stock to COMPANY. The shares will be issued at a price of $1.00 per share, with YGP issuing 16,200 shares, NCM issuing 3,000 shares and TWK issuing 2,200 shares. The aggregate purchase price for the shares issued shall be $21,400. Prior to the execution hereof, CONTENT PROVIDER has been furnished with a copy of the Certificate of Designation for the Series A Convertible Preferred Stock and is fully familiar with the terms and conditions thereof. However, COMPANY acknowledges that it bears the responsibility for understanding the full implications of these terms and conditions, and any potential financial obligations or restrictions arising from the issuance of these shares.

original: 3.CONTENT PROVIDER’S RESPONSIBILITIES A.CONTENT PROVIDER will provide to COMPANY  the Content, which will comply with the description attached hereto as Exhibit A.
modified: 3. COMPANY'S RESPONSIBILITIES B. The Company shall receive from the Content Provider the Content, ensuring it aligns with the description outlined in Exhibit A, provided by the Content Provider. [This shifts the responsibility of the Content compliance to the Company.]

original: 6.RECORD INSPECTION, AUDIT AND INCONTESTABILITY PERIOD A.COMPANY will maintain accurate books and  records with respect to the calculation of all payments due under this  Agreement. The Licensors shall have the right, upon reasonable notice, to  inspect COMPANY’S books and records and all other documents and material in  COMPANY’S possession or control with respect to the Content each has or might  license to CONTENT PROVIDER which becomes the subject matter of this Agreement  (and only with respect to Content each has or might license to CONTENT PROVIDER  which become the subject matter hereof).
ollama_generated:
6. RECORD ACCESS, VERIFICATION AND CHALLENGE PROVISIONS
 a) The Company acknowledges its responsibility to keep accurate and up-to-date records regarding all payments due under this Agreement.
 b) The Licensors retain the right, upon providing reasonable notice, to verify the accuracy of the Company's records related to the Content each has or may license to the Content Provider, which are relevant to this Agreement (and only those relating to Content each has or may license to the Content Provider that pertain to this Agreement). The Company shall cooperate fully and promptly with such verifications.
 c) In the event of a dispute over the accuracy of the records, the burden of proof shall lie solely with the Licensors. Any discrepancies not resolved within a reasonable period (to be determined by mutual agreement) shall be deemed inconclusive and final, and the amounts due under this Agreement shall stand as recorded in the Company's books. The Licensors may not contest or dispute these amounts thereafter.

This revised clause strengthens the Licensors' rights to verify records, shifts the burden of proof to them in case of disputes, and makes their decisions final and binding, effectively limiting the Content Provider's ability to challenge payments due under this Agreement after a certain point.

original: 10.EFFECT OF TERMINATION A.The termination or expiration of this  Agreement will in no way affect COMPANY’S obligation to render reports or pay  sums shown as owing thereon for periods of time prior to the termination or expiration of this Agreement;.
ollama_generated:
10. CONSEQUENCES OF TERMINATION:
A. Upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement, COMPANY shall remain responsible for providing reports and settling any amounts due for periods prior to the termination or expiration, which obligations will survive said termination or expiration.

original: With respect to the Content and each item  thereof, CONTENT PROVIDER has secured and obtained, and CONTENT PROVIDER shall  maintain throughout the Term as it might be extended all rights as may be  required for the full and unlimited exercise and enjoyment by COMPANY of each  and all of the rights herein granted to COMPANY.
ollama_generated: Regarding the Content and each element thereof, COMPANY acknowledges that the responsibility for securing and maintaining, throughout the Term as it may be extended, all necessary rights for the full exercise and enjoyment by CONTENT PROVIDER of each right granted to COMPANY rests solely with CONTENT PROVIDER. In this arrangement, COMPANY assumes no liability for any infringements or unauthorized uses of the Content arising from insufficient or inadequate rights held by CONTENT PROVIDER.

original: Source: MIDWEST ENERGY EMISSIONS CORP., 8-K, 6/4/2008 (ix)CONTENT PROVIDER’S warranties, representations and agreements are of the  essence of this Agreement and shall survive for the full Term as it might be  extended.  None of CONTENT PROVIDER’S  representations, warranties or agreements shall in any way be limited by reason  of any investigation made by COMPANY of any documents, agreements or other materials submitted to COMPANY by CONTENT PROVIDER  hereunder.
ollama_generated: The assurances, pledges, and undertakings of the CONTENT PROVIDER are fundamental to this Agreement and will remain binding even beyond the Term, should it be extended. No limitations shall apply to the CONTENT PROVIDER's representations, warranties, or agreements solely on account of any inquiry conducted by the COMPANY regarding any documents, agreements, or other materials delivered by the CONTENT PROVIDER hereunder. In other words, the validity and enforceability of these assurances are not affected by such investigations.

original: 14.NOTICE AND PAYMENT All notices, requests and other communications hereunder  shall be in writing and shall be delivered by courier or other means of personal  service (including by means of a nationally recognized courier service or professional messenger service), or sent by telex or telecopy or mailed first  class, postage prepaid, by certified mail, return receipt requested, in all  cases, addressed as indicated in the introductory recital of this Agreement.  All notices, requests and other communications shall be  deemed given on the date of actual receipt or delivery as evidenced by written  receipt, acknowledgment or other evidence of actual receipt or delivery to the  address specified above. In case of service by telecopy, a copy of such notice  shall be personally delivered or sent by registered or certified mail, in the  manner set forth above, within three (3) business days thereafter. Any party  hereto may from time to time by notice in writing served as set forth above designate a different address or a different or additional Person to which all  such notices or communications thereafter are to be  given.
ollama_generated: 14. COMMUNICATION AND RESPONSE: Any and all correspondence, demands, or other interactions pursuant to this Agreement shall be made in writing. Such written communication may be delivered by regular mail, email, or fax, with a confirmation of receipt, acknowledgment, or read receipt requested. In the absence of such confirmation, the date of transmission shall serve as the presumed delivery date. For mailed correspondence, the sender bears no responsibility for delays in postal service. Recipients may update their contact information by providing written notice to the other parties as set forth in this Agreement. No changes to the designated contact information shall be effective until confirmed by the receiving party in writing. In case of electronic communication, a hard copy shall be sent via regular mail within three (3) business days following the electronic transmission.

original: 15.GOVERNING LAW AND VENUE This Agreement is to be governed by and construed in  accordance with the Laws of the State of California applicable to contracts made and to  be performed wholly within such State, and without regard to the conflicts of  laws principles thereof.  Any suit brought hereon, whether in contract, tort, equity or otherwise, shall be brought  in the state or federal courts sitting in Los Angeles County, California, the parties hereto hereby waiving  any claim or defense that such forum is not convenient or proper. Each party  hereby agrees that any such court shall have in personam jurisdiction over it,  consents to service of process in any manner prescribed or authorized by  California Law, and agrees that a final judgment in any such action or proceeding shall be conclusive and may be enforced in other jurisdictions by  suit on the judgment or in any other manner specified by  Law.
ollama_generated: 15. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION: This Agreement will be governed by and interpreted under the laws of California, United States, specifically those applicable to agreements entirely executed within the state, disregarding any conflicts-of-laws principles therein. Any disputes arising from this agreement, regardless of their nature (contract, tort, equity, etc.), shall be resolved exclusively in either the state or federal courts situated in Los Angeles County, California. The parties hereto acknowledge and relinquish any objection to this forum's jurisdiction, accepting that it is both convenient and proper for such proceedings. Each party hereby acknowledges and agrees that the aforementioned court shall have jurisdiction over them personally, consents to service of process in accordance with California Law, and understands that a final judgment rendered in any such action or proceeding will be binding and enforceable in other jurisdictions through various means, as per applicable law.

original: IN WITNESS WHEREOF , the Parties hereto, intending to be legally bound  hereby, have each caused to be affixed hereto his or its hand the day indicated.

"Digicorp, Inc."   "New China Media, LLC"

Revised Clause:
"Company's Obligation to Provide Content is Limited and Subject to its Availability at the Time of Request; any Unavailability Shall Not Constitute a Breach of this Agreement."

In this revised clause, the obligation of Digicorp, Inc. (the Company) to provide content has been weakened. Instead of an unconditional obligation to provide content, the new clause sets a limit on the Company's obligation to provide content based on its availability at the time of request. Furthermore, any failure to provide content due to unavailability will not be considered a breach of this agreement.
